name: Adobe Inn

reviews.text: This is a comfortable hotel in a quiet area in the middle of Carmel, two blocks south of Ocean Ave., the main drag, and about 1 mile from the ocean.
reviews.title: Well located hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel consists of three 2-story buildings joined by walkways. Beside its great location, the good things about it are its large rooms including good-size dressing areas, working fireplaces, wet bar, underground parking and free continental breakfast delivered to your door on a tray with linen. Its main drawback was its slow WiFi connection (at least in my room 23). My room also came with a good-size balcony.
reviews.title: Wonderful anniversary in Carmel!

reviews.text: The hotel has quite a few years on it, appearing to have been built in the 1950s or 1960s. This is the norm in Carmel. From my observation, to find a newish hotel you would need to go over to Monterey.
reviews.title: Adobe Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been staying at Adobe Inn in Carmel for many years. The location is right in the heart of town where everything is just a few blocks away. Service is wonderful and very attentive. They were able to reserve the perfect table for our anniversary dinner. I would strongly recommend Adobe Inn to anyone who wants a relaxing stay in a wonderful town!
reviews.title: Cozy and Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel with excellent location in the heart of Carmel town. Everything was exactly as described on their website. Would definitely stay there again. Very good value for money compared with other hotels in similar locations.
reviews.title: A little gem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For our 25th anniversary, we went back to where we started: Carmel. This wasn't the hotel we stayed at (that one was sold out). This was one of the few that was still open for the days we wanted. The Adobe Inn is a family-owned and an older property, but relatively well maintained. We had a king room and even though it faced the street, it was far enough from the main "drag" Ocean Avenue to remain fairly quiet. The room was very spacious and comfortable. It had a fireplace (probably not wood-burning), terry robes, a small refrigerator, Comcast Cable and free wireless in the room. Wonderful high-quality bed linens. It also had underground parking, which was an advantage over other places that have street parking or small lots. The people were very nice and friendly.
reviews.title: Convenient and Quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Things that could be improved: the bed was just okay. The towels weren't very plush and were defniitely aging. There also seemed to be a fair amount of dust on the furniture. I noticed it because the picture in the bathroom sink area was visibly dusty. The bathtub and shower looked a bit dingy and something they might want to replace soon. And we noticed that it was very warm in the room, although they do provide a small fan in the closet. There are no screens on the windows so you'll have bugs flying in the room if you do need to ventilate the room. On the other hand, the room had central heating, no noisy AC unit by the window.
reviews.title: pretty perfect

reviews.text: With those reservations, I would still rcommend Adobe Inn. We weren't in the room very much anyway and the convenience of a short walk to the main business area of Carmel was a real plus.
reviews.title: delightful place, enchanting

reviews.text: A great little place- close to everything, parking, and well run. The staff could not be nicer. The building is dated, but the rooms are immaculate, comfortable, and spacious. I would return to the Adobe anytime.
reviews.title: Like a second home

reviews.text: this is very delightful and enchanting place. the people are very friendly and efficient. breakfast is very ample. the rooms are well furnished and are exactly what the description is on the internet. service is excellent. spent three days with some friends from canada and their opinion is the same. we will be back again.
reviews.title: I love this place - great area - APerkins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Either hotels are getting better or thanks to Trip Advisor and other websites I'm getting better at picking great hotels. We were 4 for 4 on our recent trip up the CA coastal highway. All had slightly different "vibes" but all were very nice places to stay in their own way. Adobe Inn in Carmel was great in what I would call the "up-to-date and trendy/traditional" category. The room was huge and well appointed. Nice touches here and there and best of all a fireplace with a nice sitting area--perfect for nights on the coast when there's a chill in the air.
reviews.title: Great place in Carmel

reviews.text: The location in Carmel was perfect. We parked in their huge underground garage (often such places are cramped and just made for scrapes on your rental car, but not this one) and walked everywhere. Wonderful access to the many great restaurants in Carmel. There was a small but pleasant pool that we did not use but it, and the surrounding garden-like area, contributed to the great sense of caring and upkeep this place gives. All in all a great pick.
reviews.title: Gem of a hotel with a wonderful sunset view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BTW, I debated long and hard about whether to stay in Carmel or Monterey. So glad we picked Carmel. It has a wonderful feel of a small town (but with very upscale tastes) with flowers everywhere and perfect quiet for sleeping. Monterey, OTOH, is very touristy. Fun to go to for a day trip, but glad we could retreat to Carmel for dinner and the evening.
reviews.title: Very good room, bad Breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved this hotel. Huge comfortable well-decorated room. Breakfast delivered to your room as standard. Fab views of the Pacific which can be enjoyed from the comfort of your own balcony. Staff were incredibly friendly & helpful. Would def stay here again.
reviews.title: Charming & well located
A lovely hotel
reviews.text: We stayed there only for a night. The hotel is very close to the main street, the room is very big and spacious, with a big and very comfortable bed and good bathroom. TV although is quite old and located in one side of the bed... But that is really not a big problem, as I believe most of the people that go to Carmel don't end up spending much time inside the room...

Adobe Inn is an excellent choice to stay in Carmel. The inn is in a great location and everything is within walking distance, shops, beach, restaurants, cafes. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The inn provides parking for its guests, which is very convenient, especially for a place such as Carmel.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: However, what makes this inn special is its General Manager, Sergio Javier, for whom I cannot say enough. My family of four arrived at the inn last week around 12:00am. We had talked to the office about arriving this late and they had left the key with instructions for us under the door mat of the room. However, when we opened the door we discovered that instead of two queen beds, the room had only one king size bed. Something probably went wrong when I made the reservation online; the problem was that we could not all sleep in one bed and there were no extra blankets for one of us to sleep on the floor. Moreover, everything was closed and we were extremely tired after traveling for 4.5 hours from Santa Barbara. I had read the reviews about Sergio being very responsive so I decided to give him a call. Sure enough he responded right away. Although he lives 30 minutes away from the inn and it was 12:15am, Sergio came and opened for us a suite with two rooms and three queen beds. We were not charged for the bigger room even though we offered to pay the difference. This is customer service at the highest level and we greatly appreciate it. Thanks Sergio! People like you make customers come back again and again.
reviews.title: We loved it!
excellent location
reviews.text: This was a girl's trip...we just wanted to have fun! Sergio upgraded our room and it was wonderful! We had a large living room with a nice fireplace, two bathrooms, and a large bedroom with two queen beds. We loved having breakfast every morning in our room, served on a silver tray - the warm muffins and granola were so good! The Adobe Inn is older, as are most things in Carmel, but it's very well maintained, the decor is updated and very attractive, and the housekeeping was excellent. The grounds are very pretty, lots of flowers, patios, and balconies...there's also a dry sauna, which was just what we needed. The location is the best - on Dolores and very close to the heart of all of the fun. Anything we asked for was taken care of quickly and the staff were all very good to us. This property is not your modern, sophisticated, state-of-the-art, canned hotel room...it's what a visit to Carmel is all about - cozy, quaint, charming, friendly, relaxing, and fun, with excellent service. We stayed almost a week...wish we could have stayed longer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my husband and I stayed here for 2 nights and loved that everything was within walking distance. Self parking made it very easy to come in and out, the breakfast was good--loved the granola. Room was dated but clean. We had purchased some wine and the front desk gave us wine glasses to use instead of the paper cups that were in the room. That was a very nice special touch. Carmel is a beautiful little town and this Inn has the perfect location to see it all.
reviews.title: Cozy location but property dated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While not great, it's an overall cozy experience to stay here. The rooms are spacious and have seating areas in front of what I guess qualifies as a fire.It's kind of a pathetic fireplace with tiny gas flames but still manages to be a little romantic. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable but the noise level was too high. There is a spacious balcony with a limited view of the Ocean some 7 blocks away. Very woodsy area. Unless you are in need of ADA, do not check into room number 26. It's right next to the pool as well as the staircase leading upstairs. When those folks roll in at 1:30 in the morning, you will both hear and feel them.
reviews.title: a bit disalutioned

description: South Western Adobe style, rooms with balcony or patio; located just a short walk to the village shops and restaurants.
